page.title: 08THE NORTH MARCHES
page.content: Each year a cavalcade rides the north marches. The cavalcade consists of the Selkirk Standard Bearer, his Attendants and about 600 horses. This rideout has a history which stretches over 400 years and is now more symbolic than it has been. The rideouts were necessary to protect the towns lands and where necessary move the boundary markers back to their original positions. The rideout takes place on the second Friday after the first Monday in June. The Burgh Standard is carried all the way round the march. Linglie Farm on the route is still owned by the town. Recent attempts to sell off the land met with considerable opposition from the local people.
